creditline: Gift of Joan B. Mirviss and Robert J. Levine
description: irregular vessel that is tall and thin; wider at the base than at the mouth with a wider part near the middle; horizontal stripe with jagged edges along the bottom of the stripes; stripes are made from two different clay bodies: one is smooth and tan in color and the other has larger inclusions and is grey in color; shiny grey glaze on interior
text: In another variation of his wave pattern, Kamoda carved the surfaces of his vessels with jagged undulations. These he filled with a lighter clay slip. Once they were leather-hard, he scraped away the excess, revealing the pattern created by the contrast of the gray clay body and the lighter slip.
title: Gray and beige vessel
